Yeah If only the new Runes didn't work like Masteries. So the fact it pretends you need as much pages for these Runes as you needed for old Runes is dumb.

This is actually a textbook business tactic.  It's called a rebranding scheme.  You take X product/service and rebrand it as Y even though in actuality it is still X.  They baked runes into the new Mastery system, but then they rebanded the new Masteries as Runes and slapped on the three rune page limit.  Where once we could have ten plus Masteries depending on champion, role, etc we are now limited to three Mastery setups without a soul crushing grind of 6300 Blue Essence per Mastery setup.  I strongly urge everyone to make it a point to call these what they really are.  Masteries.  They are not runes.  The runes are baked into the new Masteries.  It's a cash grabbing rebranding scheme and it stinks to high heaven.

Also like the old Mastery system however you can edit your Rune pages in lobby so it won't really affect people who are more familiar with the system since higher ranked players like Valkrin and Bjergsen often made their mastery pages while in champ select and only had 1-2 pages pre-made. It will just take time but even if you don't have a ton of pages bought you can always make them on the fly if you're quick enough in your decision making
If only they allowed you to alter them during the champ select phase...

That is missing the point here.  You could in theory do the same thing with the old Masteries.  However, if we turned back the clock and told you the Mastery system was being changed to have the same default limit of three as runes how well do you think that would have gone?  That's exactly what this change is.  These are Masteries that have been rebranded as runes (the old runes are baked into the new mastery system).  It's a classic rebranding scheme from the Hail Corporate handbook.
